meanings.definition: To affix a seal to (a document)
meanings.sent1: I will enseal the letter with my signature.
meanings.sent2: She always makes sure to enseal important papers.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to enseal the envelope with its paw, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: His promise to always be there for her was ensealed with a heartfelt hug.
meanings.sent5: The ancient king would enseal his decrees with a wax seal for authenticity.

meanings.definition: To confirm or authenticate with a seal
meanings.sent1: The notary will enseal the contract to make it official.
meanings.sent2: They had to enseal the document before it could be considered valid.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to enseal the evidence with a special stamp.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to enseal their friendship in that moment.
meanings.sent5: The handshake was a way to enseal the agreement between them.

meanings.definition: A seal or stamp used to authenticate a document
meanings.sent1: The royal enseal was placed on the decree to show its legitimacy.
meanings.sent2: She carefully examined the enseal on the certificate.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy chewed on the enseal, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The enseal on the ancient scroll was still intact after centuries.
meanings.sent5: The golden enseal gleamed in the dim light, adding an air of importance to the letter.
